items.content_html:
Description

Clarifies that command key object properties are optional and provides additional illustrative examples.
items.title: Clarify that command key object properties are optional

items.content_html:
Description

Following the discussion in w3c/manifest#1147 and confirmation from spec editors, this PR updates:

  • scope page:

    • Improves the description of scope fallback behavior.
    • Removes the statement about the requirement of start_url to be within scope.

  • start_url page:

    • Reorders sentences in the "Values" section for better flow.
    • Moves the same-origin information from "Values" to "Description" - it is not a requirement to be met, rather how start_url is processed in relation to the installation page. This has been explained in the "Description" section along with an example.
items.title: docs(manifest): Update `start_url` and `scope` pages based on document URL clarifications

items.content_html: part of openwebdocs/project#214
items.title: New pages: CSS SVG filter properites

items.content_html: the information box links to the element page, not to the element directly, so adding this required child to the content.

items.content_html:
Removes the word simple where appropriate.
also removed a bit of legacy CSS 2.1 and SVG support text that is no longer needed or valid.
items.title: Remove simple part 7: SVG files

items.content_html: I left 68 occurrences of "simple", simpler, simplest, especially if it sounded like the name of a feature. I think these are ok to remove.

items.content_html:
Description

BCD has renamed InkPresenter to DelegatedInkTrailPresenter in mdn/browser-compat-data#24856

also, the expectedImprovement has become non-standard and deprecated

see https://wicg.github.io/ink-enhancement/, WICG/ink-enhancement#35, WICG/ink-enhancement#34, WICG/ink-enhancement#36

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Rename `InkPresenter` to `DelegatedInkTrailPresenter`

items.content_html:
Description

This prepares for the new sidebars and L10n for macros (templates) is moved to jsondata.

Note

MDN engineering will back port any changes to sidebars or macros from yari until we make a cut over.

Motivation

Prepare to merge mdn/yari#12051

Additional details

For now these are protected by the code owners but will be opened up soon.
items.title: feat(rari): support for template l10n and new sidebars

items.content_html:
Description

  • textarea selector was used multiple times, even though there is no <textarea> in the HTML.

div + div selector was changed to p + p, as all input and label elements are nested inside p elements, and not divs in the example.

Motivation

The extra selectors confused me as I was trying to copy the styling, and I thought there was something I had missed.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: remove superflous and wrong selectors
